page.title: 08Hellens
page.content: The original stone building was built for Ysuelt Mortimer the daughter of a powerful baron who owned most of the land in the area.She married an Audley and it was their descendants who built a house of brick on the same site.This house is said to be one of the first houses of brick in England and dates from the 15th century.One of the owners was a friend of The Black Prince.The stone carving over the main fireplace depicts the crest of The Prince Of Wales which has inscibed below it "ICH DIENE".The two chairs either side of the fireplace were made for the visit of Mary Tudor.A bedroom upstairs is decorated in her honour this is where the family priest was killed during the civil war and is haunted.The house contains many famous pictures including a portrait of Raphael valued at Â£750,000.
